feels.name: Amusement
feels.quote: I was reading that everlasting Belsham, and droning away as I always do, for aunt soon drops off, and then I take out some nice book, and read like fury till she wakes up. I actually made myself sleepy; and, before she began to nod, I gave such a gape that she asked me what I meant by opening my mouth wide enough to take the whole book in at once.

feels.name: Contentment
feels.quote: I believe they were never disappointed, or sorry that they took the old woman's advice.

feels.name: Reflection
feels.quote: I've got something to tell. It isn't funny, like Jo's story, but I thought about it a good deal as I came home.

feels.name: Compassion
feels.quote: When I went to get some oysters for Hannah, Mr. Laurence was in the fish-shop; but he didn't see me, for I kept behind a barrel, and he was busy with Mr. Cutter, the fish-man.

causedByEvent.name: Seeing Mr. Laurence's act of kindness

feels.name: Moral Upliftment
feels.quote: I never, never should have got over such a agonizing mortification.
